Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 3e52d588d49da87be27f9f8388e9af250ed1bfc3
@PL - this needs a rebase.
updated.

I verified the patch set with multiple parts PDRs in Ampere system. The pldmtool can get all parts.
Great patch set.
Will the `instanceId` change when we use while at this position?
`instanceId` is changed in each exec is corrected. So I think the added code is unnecessary.
In the patch set #5, I removed your change to support `Fix instanceId`.

Should use `transfer_resp_flag` definition in libpldm.
About `start` flag, DSP0248 section GetPDRs, transferFlag field (Start = 0x00). But in DSP0240, table `MultipartSend command format` transferFlag field , START = 1 as definition in transfer_resp_flag.
So I suggest to use the definition in DSP0240.
Done

Sorry for the confusing. After this comment in other patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/63028/comments/a8258e1a_a573386e I thought we should not mix the values of transferFlag in DSP0240 and DSP0248. Because GetPDRs is belong to DSP0248 so we should apply the values in DSP0248.
The value in transfer_resp_flag is from DSP0240, so I think we should add pldm_platform_transfer_resp_flag in platform.h of libpldm. Then apply those constant in this patch set.

I simply the checking condition in patch set #5.
In that patch set, we only use `End` and `StartAndEnd` flag which are the same in both DSP0240 and DSP248.
Done
Can we use c++ type casting?
Done
Magic numbers, use definition in `transfer_resp_flag` of libpldm.
Done
Tested section?

I don't think we have the unit-test for pldmtool.

New transferFlags for Platform and Controls PLDM commands.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/72593
This patch set should use those macros.
Done
